member.name: F:Styx.WoWGameObjectState.Active
member.summary: Show in world as used and not reset. (Closed door open)

member.summary: Show in world as read. (Closed door close)

member.name: F:Styx.WoWGameObjectState.ActiveAlternative
member.summary: Show in world as used in alt way and not reset (closed door open by cannon fire)

member.name: F:Styx.GameObjectFlags.InUse
member.summary: 0x1 Disables interaction while animated

member.name: F:Styx.GameObjectFlags.Locked
member.summary: 0x2 Requires a key, spell, event, etc to be opened. Makes "Locked" appear in tooltip

member.name: F:Styx.GameObjectFlags.ConditionalInteraction
member.summary: 0x4 Objects that require a condition to be met before they are usable

member.name: F:Styx.GameObjectFlags.Transport
member.summary: 0x8 any kind of transport? Object can transport (elevator, boat, car)

member.name: F:Styx.GameObjectFlags.DoesNotDespawn
member.summary: 0x20 These objects never de-spawn, but typically just change state in response to an event Ex: doors

member.name: F:Styx.GameObjectFlags.Triggered
member.summary: 0x40 Typically, summoned objects. Triggered by spell or other events

member.name: M:Styx.CommonBot.Profiles.CustomForcedBehavior.GetAttributeAs``1(System.String,System.Boolean,Styx.CommonBot.Profiles.CustomForcedBehavior.IConstraintChecker{``0},System.String[])
member.summary:
This class is for use only with reference-types (e.g., string).
is the corresponding method for use with value-types (e..g, double, int, WoWPoint).
-----
Examines the argument list looking for the specified , and returns the parsed representation of the attribute's value. The attribute may also be found as one of the aliases provided in .

remarks.para: Error messages are sent to the Styx logging facilities under the following conditions:
* The attribute is required, but the attribute could not be found using its primary name or one of its aliases.
* The attribute value is malformed.
* The attribute does not fall within the specified constraint

member.param: the name of the attribute for which we look in the argument list. This value may not be null, or the empty string ("").
true, if the attribute is required; false, if the attribute is optional.

A method that further constrains the input beyond its native type. If the input should not be constrained beyond its native type, supply null for this parameter.
There are a number of preset constraints provided by the class. There are also a number of prebuilt constraint classes that implement the interface-- these prebuilt classes begin with the name "ConstrainTo".

an array of alternate names that the attribute is known as. The primary purpose of this field is for backward-compatibility when attributes get renamed. If there are no other names by which the attribute is known, supply null for this parameter.

returns.para: a parsed represention of the attribute's value, if it could be located using its primary name or an alias. The parsed representation will also meet any constraint that has been specified.
Otherwise, null is returned if there was any kind of problem, or the attribute was not present in the argument list.

example.code: string TriggerPhrase { get; set; } TriggerPhrase = GetAttributeAs<string>("CannonAngle", false, ConstrainAs.StringNonEmpty, null) ?? string.Empty;

member.name: M:Styx.CommonBot.Profiles.CustomForcedBehavior.GetAttributeAsArray``1(System.String,System.Boolean,Styx.CommonBot.Profiles.CustomForcedBehavior.IConstraintChecker{``0},System.String[],System.Char[])

summary.para: This method is primarily to support backward-compatibility. Constructing data that requires the use of this method is un-XML-like, and its use is discouraged.
Examines the argument list looking for the specified , and returns the parsed representation of the attribute's value. The attribute may also be found as one of the aliases provided in .
The value of the located argument is expected to be in the form of a delineated composite. If the parameter is provided as null, the separator characters default to space, comma, and semicolon.

For example, an integer list could be formatted as follows: "1,6,3,1,2,-1", "1 6 3 1 2 -1", or "1; 6; 3; 1; 2; -1". Since the method is a generic, you may also use for other data types such as boolean (e.g., "true,false,true,true"), enumerations (e.g., "Black; Blue; DarkRed; White"), and other types.
Each argument in the composite must adhere to any constraint that is provided by the caller.

Although this method can also be used for strings, the comma/space/semicolon as separation characters, typically makes the returned results difficult to use. When string are employed, the caller may need to supply a non-null value for that is chosen judiciously.

If <T> is a WoWPoint, the the are ignored, and the attribute value must follow a rigid format. WoWPoints are formatted in one of the following ways: "X1, Y1,Z1|X2,Y2,Z2|X3..." or "X1,Y1,Z1;X2,Y2,Z2;X3...".

remarks.para: This method will never return null. Instead, an empty array is returned if a problem was encountered, or the attribute could not be located in the argument list.
If <T> is WoWPoint, then separatorCharacters are ignored, and the attribute formatting must follow a rigid format as previously described.
Error messages are sent to the Styx logging facilities under the following conditions:
* The attribute is required, but the attribute could not be found using its primary name or one of its aliases.
* The attribute value is malformed.
* The attribute does not fall within the specified constraint

member.param: the name of the attribute for which we look in the argument list. This value may not be null, or the empty string ("").
true, if the attribute is required; false, if the attribute is optional.

A method that further constrains the input beyond its native type. If the input should not be constrained beyond its native type, supply null for this parameter.
There are a number of preset constraints provided by the class. There are also a number of prebuilt constraint classes that implement the interface-- these prebuilt classes begin with the name "ConstrainTo".

an array of alternate names that the attribute is known as. The primary purpose of this field is for backward-compatibility when attributes get renamed. If there are no other names by which the attribute is known, supply null for this parameter.

an array of characters that will be used as separators to delineate the attribute's value into array members. Note: if <T> is WoWPoint, then the separator characters are ignored, and the argument list must adhere to a specific format.

returns.para: a parsed represention of the attribute's value, if it could be located using its primary name or an alias. The parsed representation will also meet any constraint that has been specified.
Otherwise, an empty array is returned if there was any kind of problem, or the attribute was not present in the argument list.

example.code: string TriggerPhrase { get; set; } TriggerPhrase = GetAttributeAsArray<string>("TriggerPhrase", false, ConstrainAs.StringNonEmpty, null, null) ?? string.Empty;

member.name: M:Styx.CommonBot.Profiles.CustomForcedBehavior.GetNumberedAttributesAsArray``1(System.String,System.Int32,Styx.CommonBot.Profiles.CustomForcedBehavior.IConstraintChecker{``0},System.String[])
member.summary:
This method looks for attributes with a prefix specified as
followed by an integer value (e.g., ButtonPhrase1, ButtonPhrase2, ButtonPhrase3). Such located parameters are collected and returned as an array. An argument consisting of just the prefix and no following number (e.g., ButtonPhrase) is considered as part of the acceptable set of parameters found. An argument that does not fit the form of prefix- followed-by-number will be ignored (e.g., ButtonPhrase3n, ButtonPhrases, etc). Attributes are also looked for under prefixes specified by
Any found arguments must adhere to the specified by the caller.
The argument determines how many of the similarly- named attributes must be found; otherwise, an error is reported and an empty array is returned. If <T> is a WoWPoint, then three parameters will be sought, one parameter each that identifies the X, Y, and Z contribution. If any of these three parameters doesn't exist, then this is considered an error in the argument list.

remarks.para: This method will never return null. Instead, an empty array is returned if a problem was encountered, or the attributes could not be located in the argument list.
If <T> is a WoWPoint, then parameters will be sought with a X/Y/Z following the number. In other words, "WaitPosition3X" is a valid attribute name--"WaitPositionX3" is invalid.
Error messages are sent to the Styx logging facilities under the following conditions:
* The attribute is required, but the attribute could not be found using its primary name or one of its aliases.
* The attribute value is malformed.
* The attribute does not fall within the specified constraint

member.param: a prefix used for the primary name of the arguments sought.
the number of similarly-named arguments that must be encountered for success.

A method that further constrains the input beyond its native type. If the input should not be constrained beyond its native type, supply null for this parameter.
There are a number of preset constraints provided by the class. There are also a number of prebuilt constraint classes that implement the interface-- these prebuilt classes begin with the name "ConstrainTo".
alternative prefixes under which to look for acceptable attributes.

returns.para: an array comprised of the values of all located arguments. The arguments will adhere to the identified by the caller.
Otherwise, an empty array is returned if no such parameters could be located, or the number of arguments was not encountered.

member.name: F:Styx.CommonBot.Profiles.CustomForcedBehavior._isAttributeProblem
member.summary: Initialized to 'false' when the concrete behavior is created, this value gets set to 'true' if an error (not warning) is encountered in one of the GetAttribute*() methods. Note, that this field can only be set to true, and once set, it always remains true

summary.para: This should be the first method called in a concrete CustomForcedBehavior's OnStart() method. When this is called, it will emit error messages that have occurred due to argument processing. The messages sent to the Styx log indicate which line of the profile is generating the problem.
If there was a problem with argument processing, this method arranges for Honorbudy to cease executing the profile.
This method also informs the user if the behavior will be skipped because the completion criteria were met when the behavior was called.

member.name: M:Styx.CommonBot.Profiles.CustomForcedBehavior.LogMessage(System.String,System.Nullable{System.Windows.Media.Color},System.String,System.Object[])

summary.para: This utility method issues a message (comprised of FORMAT and ARGS) to the Styx logging facilities.
The message will be prefixed with information clearly identifying the behavior in the following form: [BEHAVIOR_NAME-vVERNUM(MESSAGETYPE) @line 647]: MESSAGE
If MESSAGECOLOR is provided, the message will be rendered in the requested color. If MESSAGECOLOR is null, the color is selected based on MESSAGETYPE:

description.para: * MESSAGETYPE="fatal": (Red) goes to normal log and HONORBUDDY is STOPPED
* MESSAGETYPE=anything else: (DarkGray) goes to normal log

member.param: assumes one of the following values: "fatal", "error", "warning", "info", "debug". Any other value is allowed, however the message will be not be highlighted for the user's attention. A messageType of "fatal" will also stop the profile. A messageType of "debug" will be emitted to the Debug Log instead of the 'normal' log.
format spec of the message that should be logged. This works the same as the format spec provided to string.Format().
arguments to be given to the format spec to build complete message.

member.name: T:Styx.WoWInternals.WoWCurrencyType
member.summary: Values that represent WoWCurrencyType.

member.name: F:Styx.WoWInternals.WoWCurrencyType.ChampionSeal
member.summary: Champion's Seals are the currency rewarded and used at the Argent Tournament. They are accumulated by completing Argent Tournament daily quests, and can be exchanged with your faction's quartermasters for various rewards.

member.name: F:Styx.WoWInternals.WoWCurrencyType.ChefsAward
member.summary: Chef's Awards are currency related to the Cooking skill. They can be earned by completing daily cooking quests in your faction's home city (Stormwind City / Orgrimmar). They can be used to purchase new cooking recipes from the Sous Chef in your home city.

member.name: F:Styx.WoWInternals.WoWCurrencyType.ConquestPoints
member.summary: Conquest Points are the higher tier of PvP content rewards. They are earned from doing ranked arena matches and rated battlegrounds. The lower tier currency, Honor Points, is earned from un-rated battlegrounds, un-ranked arena matches, honorable kills, and controlling Wintergrasp.

member.name: F:Styx.WoWInternals.WoWCurrencyType.DalaranCookingAward
member.summary: Dalaran Cooking Awards are rewarded from level 80 daily cooking quests in Dalaran. They can be used to purchase level 400-450 cooking recipes, as well as Northern Spices and the mighty Chef's Hat.

member.name: F:Styx.WoWInternals.WoWCurrencyType.DalaranJewelcraftersToken
member.summary: Dalaran Jewelcrafter's Tokens are rewarded from level 80 jewelcrafting daily quests in Dalaran. They can be used to purchase level 370-450 jewelcrafting designs.

member.name: F:Styx.WoWInternals.WoWCurrencyType.DraeneiArchaeologyFragment
member.summary: Draenei Archaeology Fragments are discovered via the Survey ability in Archaeology. They are gathered via surveying, saved up, and used to create the items listed below. Draenei fragments are all found in Outland.

member.name: F:Styx.WoWInternals.WoWCurrencyType.DwarfArchaeologyFragment
member.summary: Dwarf Archaeology Fragments are discovered via the Survey ability in Archaeology. They are gathered via surveying, saved up, and used to create the items listed below. Dwarf fragments are found in centers of historical dwarven habitation, such as the Badlands, the Wetlands, and Loch Modan.

member.name: F:Styx.WoWInternals.WoWCurrencyType.FossilArchaeologyFragment
member.summary: Fossil Archaeology Fragments are discovered via the Survey ability in Archaeology. They are gathered via surveying, saved up, and used to create the items listed below. Fossil fragments are usually found in locations such as Un'Goro Crater and Desolace.

member.name: F:Styx.WoWInternals.WoWCurrencyType.HonorPoints
member.summary: Honor Points are the lower tier of PvP content rewards. They have replaced all forms of pre 4.0 PvP rewards. You can earn Honor Points from non-rated battlegrounds, unranked arenas, honorable kills, or from controlling Wintergrasp. Rated battlegrounds and ranked arenas reward Conquest Points instead.

member.name: F:Styx.WoWInternals.WoWCurrencyType.IllustriousJewelcrafterToken
member.summary: Illustrious Jewelcrafter's Tokens are rewarded from faction-based daily quests in your factions home city (Stormwind City / Orgrimmar) They can be used to purchase level 465-525 jewelcrafting designs from your faction's quartermaster.

member.name: F:Styx.WoWInternals.WoWCurrencyType.JusticePoints
member.summary: Justice Points are a type of currency that is rewarded via participating in instanced PvE content, such as dungeons and raids, and is used to purchase tier sets. Justice Points are the lower of the two tiers of PvE rewards, and are rewarded for completing your first random normal dungeon each day, as well as for defeating heroic bosses. Raid bosses, as well as the your first random heroic each day, reward Valor Points.

member.name: F:Styx.WoWInternals.WoWCurrencyType.MarkoftheWorldTree
member.summary: Mark of the World Tree is the currency that will be used to unlock the The Regrowth and Molten Front Daily Quest Hubs at the player's discretion. The currency will be rewarded in small amounts from the daily quests in the zone (similar to Champion's Seals) and will be spendable by the player in some manner in order to unlock more dailies and/or cause further storyline progression to occur. This way players can experience the story and phasing at their own pace, rather than on a timeline or the pace of the rest of the sever.

member.name: F:Styx.WoWInternals.WoWCurrencyType.NerubianArchaeologyFragment
member.summary: Nerubian Archaeology Fragments are discovered via the Survey ability in Archaeology. They are gathered via surveying, saved up, and used to create the items listed below. Nerubian fragments are all found in Northrend, typically in areas of Nerubian habitation such as Dragonblight.

member.name: F:Styx.WoWInternals.WoWCurrencyType.NightElfArchaeologyFragment
member.summary: Night Elf Archaeology Fragments are discovered via the Survey ability in Archaeology. They are gathered via surveying, saved up, and used to create the items listed below. Night elf fragments are typically found in areas such as Ashenvale and Darkshore.

member.name: F:Styx.WoWInternals.WoWCurrencyType.OrcArchaeologyFragment
member.summary: Orc Archaeology Fragments are discovered via the Survey ability in Archaeology. They are gathered via surveying, saved up, and used to create the items listed below. Orc fragments are exclusively found in Outland, particularly in areas such as Nagrand. If this confuses you, remember that orcs are native to Outlandthey invaded Azeroth through the dark portal in the First War, detailed in the original Warcraft: Orcs and Humans.

member.name: F:Styx.WoWInternals.WoWCurrencyType.TolBaradCommendation
member.summary: Tol Barad Commendations are the currency rewarded for completing daily quests in Tol Barad. These quests are unlocked when your faction controls the zone. Tol Barad Commendations can be used to purchase rewards from your faction's Tol Barad Quartermaster.

member.name: F:Styx.WoWInternals.WoWCurrencyType.TolvirArchaeologyFragment
member.summary: Tol'vir Archaeology Fragments are discovered via the Survey ability in Archaeology. They are gathered via surveying, saved up, and used to create the items listed below. Tol'vir fragments are exclusively found in level 80+ zones in Azeroth, particularly in areas such as Uldum.

member.name: F:Styx.WoWInternals.WoWCurrencyType.TrollArchaeologyFragment
member.summary: Troll Archaeology Fragments are discovered via the Survey ability in Archaeology. They are gathered via surveying, saved up, and used to create the items listed below. Troll fragments are frequently found in areas such as The Hinterlands and Stranglethorn Vale.

member.name: F:Styx.WoWInternals.WoWCurrencyType.ValorPoints
member.summary: Valor Points are a type of currency that is rewarded via participating in instanced PvE content, such as dungeons and raids, and is used to purchase tier sets. Valor Points are the higher of the two tiers of PvE rewards, and are rewarded for completing your first random heroic dungeon each day, as well as for defeating raid bosses. Heroic bosses, as well as the your first random normal dungeon each day, reward Justice Points.

member.name: F:Styx.WoWInternals.WoWCurrencyType.VrykulArchaeologyFragment
member.summary: Vrykul Archaeology Fragments are discovered via the Survey ability in Archaeology. They are gathered via surveying, saved up, and used to create the items listed below. Vrykul fragments are exclusively found in Northrend, especially in areas such as Howling Fjord and Icecrown.

member.summary: Information about the wo w totem.

member.summary: Gets a unique identifier for the totem (Only valid if the totem is actually out!).

member.summary: Returns true if the totem has expired. (Ran its full duration)
member.value: true if expired, false if not.

member.summary: Gets the unit that this totem info represents.

member.summary: Gets the slot for this totem. (0-3).

member.summary: Gets the duration, in milliseconds, that the totem will stay out.

member.name: P:Styx.WoWInternals.WoWTotemInfo.StartTime
member.summary: Gets the time of when this totem was laid out.

member.name: P:Styx.WoWInternals.WoWTotemInfo.Expires
member.summary: Gets the time when this totem will expire.

member.name: P:Styx.WoWInternals.WoWTotemInfo.WoWTotem
member.summary: Gets the totem this represents. (Strength of Earth, Healing Stream, etc)

member.name: P:Styx.WoWInternals.WoWTotemInfo.Spell
member.summary: Gets the spell that creates this totem.

member.name: P:Styx.WoWInternals.WoWTotemInfo.IconPath
member.summary: Gets the full pathname of the icon file. (This is an MPQ path!)
member.value: The full pathname of the icon file.

member.name: P:Styx.WoWInternals.WoWTotemInfo.Name
member.summary: Gets the name of this totem. (This is NOT always in English! Do not use this as an identifier!)

member.summary: Gets the type of totem this represents. (Fire, Earth, Water, Air)
